Pedestrian struck, killed on Bardstown Road

Communities

Kirsten Clark, Louisville 5:47 p.m. EST December 20, 2014

police line(Photo: Getty Images)

Tags

  • Chrysler
CONNECT 2 TWEETLINKEDINCOMMENTEMAILMORE

A pedestrian is dead after a vehicle ran off the road and struck a man walking in the grass near the intersection of Bardstown Road and Breckenridge Lane.

Louisville Metro Police Department responded to the 4700 block of Bardstown Road at about 4 p.m. Saturday to a reported collision involving a vehicle and a pedestrian, LMPD spokesman Dwight Mitchell said in an email.

Mitchell said it appears the driver of a green Chrysler was traveling north on Bardstown Road when it ran off the roadway for unknown reasons and struck the man walking in the grass.

The pedestrian received fatal injuries and was pronounced dead at the scene, Mitchell said. The driver did not sustain any injuries.

The investigation is ongoing.

Reporter Kirsten Clark can be reached at (502) 582-4144 or on Twitter at @kirstenlmclark.
